definition[0]: a hole or pipe through which gases, liquid etc can enter or escape from an enclosed space or container
definition[1]: a thin straight opening at the bottom of the back or side of a jacket or coat
definition[2]: the small hole through which small animals, birds, fish etc pass waste matter out of their bodies
definition[3]: to express feelings of anger, hatred etc, especially by doing something violent or harmful
example[2]: The meeting gave us a chance to vent our spleen  (=anger).
example[3]: If heâ€™s had a bad day, Paul vents his anger on the family.
example[4]: I could hear mum venting her frustration by banging the pots noisily.
